resources.string: Made By\nChandrakant M and Vivek S

✅ Season: Rabi (Winter).

 ✅ Climate: Prefers cool temperatures (10-15°C) with moderate irrigation.

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained loamy and black soil.

 ✅ Usage: Used for making bread, chapati, and bakery products.

 ✅ Maharashtra Relevance: Grown in irrigated regions like Pune, Nashik, and Vidarbha.

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers and Time Period

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (Oct-Nov): Plow deeply, apply 10-12 tons/ha FYM.

 2️⃣ Sowing (Nov-Dec): Drilling method (4-5 cm depth, 20 cm row spacing). Seed rate: 100-125 kg/ha.

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (Dec-Feb): 100 kg N, 50 kg P, 50 kg K/ha before sowing; 40 kg N/ha after 30-40 days.

 4️⃣ Irrigation and Weed Control (Dec-Mar): 4-6 irrigations; Isoproturon (0.75 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5️⃣ Pest and Disease Management:

 Pests: Aphids, termites – Chlorpyrifos (2ml/L).

 Diseases: Rust, smut – Mancozeb (2g/L).

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Mar-Apr): 120-140 days; golden grains indicate maturity. Yield: 3-5 tons/ha.

✅ Season: Rabi (Winter) and Kharif (Monsoon).

 ✅ Climate: Thrives in dry conditions with moderate rainfall (25-75 cm).

 ✅ Soil: Best grown in black cotton soil with good moisture retention.

 ✅ Usage: Used for making roti (bhakri), fodder for livestock, and food processing.

 ✅ Maharashtra Relevance: A staple crop in drought-prone areas, supporting food security.

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers and Time Period

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (Oct-Nov): Plow 2-3 times, apply 5-10 tons/ha FYM.

 2️⃣ Sowing (Mid-Nov - Early Dec): Drilling method (2-3 cm depth, 45 cm row spacing). Seed rate: 8-10 kg/ha.

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (Dec-Feb): 40-50 kg N, 40 kg P, 40 kg K/ha before sowing; 25 kg N/ha after 30-35 days.

 4️⃣ Irrigation and Weed Control (Dec-Mar): Rain-fed crop but two irrigations (30-40 and 60-70 days) improve yield. Atrazine (0.5 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5️⃣ Pest and Disease Management:

 Pests: Stem borer, shoot fly – Neem oil or Chlorpyrifos (2ml/L).

 Diseases: Leaf blight, rust – Mancozeb (2g/L).

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Mar-Apr): 110-120 days; grains should be dry and hard. Yield: 2.5-3.5 tons/ha.

✅ Season: Kharif (Monsoon).

 ✅ Climate: Drought-tolerant, needs 40-50 cm rainfall.

 ✅ Soil: Best in sandy, well-drained soil.

 ✅ Usage: Used in bhakri, porridge, and fodder.

 ✅ Maharashtra Relevance: Grown in dryland farming regions like Marathwada.

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers and Time Period

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (May-June): Plow 2-3 times, apply 5-8 tons/ha FYM.

 2️⃣ Sowing (June-July): Drilling or broadcasting (2-3 cm depth, 45 cm row spacing). Seed rate: 3-4 kg/ha.

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (July-Sept): 40 kg N, 20 kg P, 20 kg K/ha before sowing; 20 kg N/ha after 30 days.

 4️⃣ Irrigation and Weed Control (July-Sept): Rain-fed; one irrigation at 30-40 days improves yield. Atrazine (0.5 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5️⃣ Pest and Disease Management:

 Pests: Shoot fly, aphids – Neem oil or Dimethoate (2ml/L).

 Diseases: Downy mildew – Metalaxyl (2g/L).

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Sept-Oct): 90-110 days. Yield: 1.5-2.5 tons/ha.

✅ Season: Kharif (Monsoon).

 ✅ Climate: Prefers warm temperatures (20-30°C) with moderate rainfall (60-100 cm).

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained black and loamy soil.

 ✅ Usage: Used for oil extraction, animal feed, and protein-rich food.

 ✅ Maharashtra Relevance: Grown extensively in Vidarbha and Marathwada.

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers and Time Period

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (May-June): Deep plowing, apply 8-10 tons/ha FYM.

 2️⃣ Sowing (June-July): Drilling method (3-4 cm depth, 45 cm row spacing). Seed rate: 75-100 kg/ha.

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (July-Sept): 30-40 kg N, 60 kg P, 30 kg K/ha before sowing.

 4️⃣ Irrigation and Weed Control (July-Sept): Rain-fed, but one irrigation at pod formation boosts yield. Pendimethalin (1 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5️⃣ Pest and Disease Management:

 Pests: Pod borer, aphids – Neem oil or Imidacloprid (2ml/L).

 Diseases: Rust, anthracnose – Mancozeb (2g/L).

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Oct-Nov): 90-110 days. Yield: 2-3 tons/ha.

✅ Season: Kharif (Monsoon).

 ✅ Climate: Requires high rainfall (100-150 cm).

 ✅ Soil: Best in clayey and alluvial soil.

 ✅ Usage: Staple food in India.

 ✅ Maharashtra Relevance: Grown in Konkan, Western Maharashtra.

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers and Time Period

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (May-June): Leveling and puddling, apply 10-12 tons/ha FYM.

 2️⃣ Sowing (June-July): Transplanting method (20 cm row spacing). Seed rate: 25-30 kg/ha.

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (July-Sept): 60 kg N, 40 kg P, 40 kg K/ha before transplanting.

 4️⃣ Irrigation and Weed Control (July-Oct): Continuous standing water. Pretilachlor (1 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5️⃣ Pest and Disease Management:

 Pests: Stem borer, leaf folder – Chlorpyrifos (2ml/L).

 Diseases: Blast, bacterial blight – Mancozeb (2g/L).

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Oct-Nov): 120-150 days. Yield: 3-6 tons/ha.

✅ Season: Rabi (Winter).

 ✅ Climate: Requires cool temperatures (20-25°C) with moderate rainfall (40-60 cm).

 ✅ Soil: Best in well-drained loamy or black cotton soil.

 ✅ Usage: Used in dal, flour (besan), and various food products.

 ✅ Maharashtra Relevance: Major pulse crop in Vidarbha and Marathwada due to its drought tolerance.

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers and Time Period

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (Oct-Nov): Deep plowing, apply 5-8 tons/ha FYM.

 2️⃣ Sowing (Nov-Dec): Drilling method (3-4 cm depth, 30 cm row spacing). Seed rate: 75-100 kg/ha.

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (Dec-Jan): 20-30 kg N, 50 kg P, 30 kg K/ha before sowing.

 4️⃣ Irrigation and Weed Control (Dec-Feb): Rain-fed crop, but one irrigation at pod development boosts yield. Pendimethalin (1 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5️⃣ Pest and Disease Management:

 Pests: Pod borer – Neem oil or Spinosad (1ml/L).

 Diseases: Wilt, blight – Mancozeb (2g/L).

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Feb-March): 110-120 days. Pods turn yellowish-brown when mature. Yield: 1.5-2.5 tons/ha.

✅ Season: Summer (March – June).

 ✅ Climate: Requires warm, humid conditions with rainfall 75-250 cm.

 ✅ Soil: Best in well-drained loamy soil with good organic content.

 ✅ Usage: Consumed fresh, in juices, pickles, and pulp-based products.

 ✅ Maharashtra Relevance: Grown in Konkan region (Ratnagiri, Sindhudurg, Raigad).

 Cultivation Process and Time Period

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (June-July): Deep plowing, FYM 10-15 tons/ha applied.

 2️⃣ Planting (July-August): Grafted saplings at 8x8m spacing.

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (Aug-Nov): Nitrogen (500g), Phosphorus (250g), Potassium (500g/tree) annually.

 4️⃣ Irrigation and Weed Control (Nov-May): Drip irrigation; Mulching prevents weeds.

 5️⃣ Pest and Disease Management:

 Pests: Mango hopper.

 Diseases: Powdery mildew – Neem oil or Carbendazim (1g/L).

 6️⃣ Harvesting (March-June): 3-5 years for fruiting. Yield: 10-15 tons/ha.
🍌 Banana \n(Grand Naine, Rasthali, Rajeli, Safed Velchi)

✅ Season: Grown year-round, main season July-October.

 ✅ Climate: Needs 27-30°C and high humidity with 150-200 cm rainfall.

 ✅ Soil: Best in well-drained alluvial soil.

 ✅ Usage: Fresh consumption, chips, pulp, fiber extraction.

 ✅ Maharashtra Relevance: Grown in Jalgaon, Pune, Nashik.

 Cultivation Process and Time Period

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (June): Deep plowing, FYM 25-30 tons/ha applied.

 2️⃣ Planting (July-August): Tissue culture plants at 1.5x1.5m spacing.

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (Aug-Nov): 200g N, 100g P, 300g K/plant.

 4️⃣ Irrigation and Weed Control (Aug-May): Drip irrigation, mulching for weed control.

 5️⃣ Pest and Disease Management:

 Diseases: Sigatoka, nematodes – Copper oxychloride (3g/L water).

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Sept-Dec): 10-12 months after planting. Yield: 40-50 tons/ha.

✅ Season: Grown year-round, peak season October-March.

 ✅ Climate: Thrives in hot, dry climate, rainfall 50-70 cm.

 ✅ Soil: Prefers light loamy or sandy soil.

 ✅ Usage: Consumed fresh, juice, medicinal uses.

 ✅ Maharashtra Relevance: Solapur, Nashik, Ahmednagar.

 Cultivation Process and Time Period

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (April-May): Plowing, 10-15 tons/ha FYM applied.

 2️⃣ Planting (June-July): 3x3m spacing, drip irrigation system.

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (July-Dec): 250g N, 125g P, 250g K/plant.

 4️⃣ Irrigation and Weed Control (July-Jan): Drip irrigation, manual weeding.

 5️⃣ Pest and Disease Management:

 Disease: Bacterial blight – Streptocycline spray (500 ppm).

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Oct-March): 18-24 months after planting. Yield: 12-15 tons/ha.

✅ Season: Summer (Feb-May).

 ✅ Climate: Requires warm temperatures (25-35°C) and low humidity.

 ✅ Soil: Best in sandy loam soil with good drainage.

 ✅ Usage: Consumed fresh, in juices, salads, and desserts.

 ✅ Maharashtra Relevance: Cultivated in Nashik, Pune, Solapur, Ahmednagar.

 🌱 Cultivation Process and Time Period

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (Dec-Jan): Deep plowing, FYM 8-10 tons/ha applied.

 2️⃣ Sowing (Jan-Feb): Direct seed sowing at 1.5x1m spacing.

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (Feb-April): 60 kg N, 30 kg P, 50 kg K/ha.

 4️⃣ Irrigation and Weed Control (Feb-May): Drip irrigation, plastic mulch for weed control.

 5️⃣ Pest and Disease Management:

 Pests: Aphids – Neem oil spray.
 Diseases: Powdery mildew – Carbendazim (1g/L water).

 6️⃣ Harvesting (April-May): 70-90 days after sowing. Yield: 25-30 tons/ha.
🍈 Papaya \n (Red Lady, Pusa Delicious, Arka Prabhath)

✅ Season: Grown year-round, best planting in June and October.

 ✅ Climate: Requires warm, humid climate (21-33°C).

 ✅ Soil: Best in well-drained sandy loam soil.

 ✅ Usage: Consumed fresh, used in juices, jams, and cosmetics.

 ✅ Maharashtra Relevance: Cultivated in Aurangabad, Pune, Jalgaon.

 Cultivation Process and Time Period

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (May and Sept): Deep plowing, 10-15 tons/ha FYM applied.

 2️⃣ Planting (June and Oct): 1.8x1.8m spacing, drip irrigation setup.

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (July-Feb): 250g N, 150g P, 250g K/tree.

 4️⃣ Irrigation and Weed Control (Year-round): Drip irrigation, manual weeding.

 5️⃣ Pest and Disease Management: Papaya mealybug – Neem oil (5ml/L water).

 6️⃣ Harvesting (9-12 months after planting): Year-round fruiting. Yield: 40-50 tons/ha.
🍏 Custard Apple \n (Sitaphal - Balanagar, Arka Sahan, NMK-1)

✅ Season: Monsoon (June-Aug) & Post-Monsoon (Sept-Dec).

 ✅ Climate: Thrives in semi-arid climate (25-35°C), low rainfall (50-100 cm).

 ✅ Soil: Best in red sandy loam or black cotton soil.

 ✅ Usage: Consumed fresh, pulp used in ice creams, milkshakes.

 ✅ Maharashtra Relevance: Grown in Beed, Solapur, Nashik, Pune.

 Cultivation Process & Time Period

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (May-June): Deep plowing, 8-10 tons/ha FYM applied.

 2️⃣ Planting (June-July): 5x5m spacing, deep pits for seedlings.

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (July-Oct): 300g N, 150g P, 300g K/tree.

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (June-Feb): Drip irrigation, mulching for weed control.

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Fruit borer – Neem oil or Malathion (2ml/L water).

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Sept-Dec): 3-4 years after planting. Yield: 8-12 tons/ha.

✅ Season: Summer & Kharif

 ✅ Climate: Warm & humid (25-35°C), rainfall 70-150 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained sandy loam to clay loam, rich in organic matter

 ✅ Usage: Used in curries, soups, fritters; also for skincare (when matured)

 ✅ Maharashtra Relevance: Grown in Pune, Kolhapur, Nagpur regions

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (Feb-March & June-July): 15-20 tons/ha FYM incorporated, field well-tilled and leveled

 2️⃣ Planting (March-April & July-Aug): Direct seeding or seedling transplanting at 1.5-2 m row spacing, 0.5-0.6 m between plants

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (April-Sept): 60 kg N, 50 kg P, 50 kg K/ha; half N at sowing, half after 30 days

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (April-Oct): Light irrigation every 6-8 days; 2-3 manual weedings

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Red pumpkin beetle – Neem oil spray (5ml/L); Downy mildew – Copper oxychloride spray (3g/L)

 6️⃣ Harvesting (May-Nov): 50-70 days after sowing, picking at tender stage, average yield 20-25 tons/ha
🧅 Onion \n (N-53, Bhima Super, Agrifound Light Red)

✅ Season: Rabi & Kharif

 ✅ Climate: Warm & dry (15-25°C), rainfall 50-100 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained loamy soil

 ✅ Usage: Used in curries, pickles, dehydrated onion flakes

 ✅ Maharashtra Relevance: Grown in Nashik, Ahmednagar, Pune

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (June-July & Oct-Nov): FYM 20 tons/ha applied

 2️⃣ Planting (July-Aug & Nov-Dec): Seeds sown at 15x10 cm spacing

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (Aug-Feb): 100 kg N, 50 kg P, 80 kg K/ha

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (Aug-March): Drip irrigation, manual weeding

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Thrips – Neem oil spray (3ml/L water)

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Jan-May): 110-140 days after planting, yield 25-30 tons/ha

✅ Season: Kharif & Rabi

 ✅ Climate: Warm & dry (20-35°C), rainfall 60-100 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained sandy loam

 ✅ Usage: Used in spices, pickles, dried chili powder

 ✅ Maharashtra Relevance: Found in Kolhapur, Sangli, Nashik

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (June-July & Oct-Nov): FYM 15-20 tons/ha applied

 2️⃣ Planting (July-Aug & Nov-Dec): Seedlings transplanted at 60x45 cm spacing

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (Aug-Feb): 90 kg N, 60 kg P, 50 kg K/ha

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (Aug-March): Drip irrigation, 2-3 weedings

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Aphids – Neem oil spray (2ml/L water)

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Jan-May): 120-150 days after transplanting, yield 20-25 tons/ha

✅ Season: Kharif & Summer

 ✅ Climate: Warm & humid (20-35°C), rainfall 50-120 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained sandy loam

 ✅ Usage: Used in curries, pickles, fried dishes

 ✅ Maharashtra Relevance: Cultivated in Solapur, Ahmednagar, Pune

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (June-July & Feb-March): FYM 15-20 tons/ha applied

 2️⃣ Sowing (July-Aug & March-April): Spacing 50x30 cm, direct seeding

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (Aug-Dec): 80 kg N, 50 kg P, 60 kg K/ha

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (Aug-Jan): Drip irrigation, manual weeding

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Shoot & fruit borer – Neem oil spray (3ml/L water)

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Oct-Jan): 60-70 days after sowing, yield 10-12 tons/ha

✅ Season: Kharif & Rabi

 ✅ Climate: Warm (20-30°C), moderate rainfall 60-100 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained loamy soil with high organic matter

 ✅ Usage: Used in curries, pickles, and stuffed dishes

 ✅ Maharashtra Relevance: Cultivated in Nashik, Pune, Solapur

 Cultivation Process & Time Period

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (June-July & Oct-Nov): FYM 20-25 tons/ha applied

 2️⃣ Planting (July-Aug & Nov-Dec): Seedlings transplanted at 60x60 cm spacing

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (Aug-Feb): 120 kg N, 80 kg P, 60 kg K/ha

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (Aug-March): Drip irrigation, manual weeding

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Shoot borer – Neem oil spray (4ml/L water)

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Nov-April): 120-140 days after transplanting, yield 35-40 tons/ha
🥦 Cauliflower (Gobhi) \n (Pusa Snowball, Punjab Giant, Pusa Deepali)

✅ Season: Rabi & Kharif

 ✅ Climate: Cool temperature (15-25°C), rainfall 50-80 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained loamy soil with good fertility

 ✅ Usage: Used in curries, pickles, processed foods

 ✅ Maharashtra Relevance: Found in Pune, Nashik, Satara

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (July-Aug): FYM 15-20 tons/ha applied

 2️⃣ Planting (Aug-Sept): Spacing 45x45 cm, seedlings transplanted

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (Aug-Dec): 100 kg N, 60 kg P, 80 kg K/ha

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (Aug-Jan): Drip irrigation, 2-3 manual weedings

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Diamondback moth – Neem oil spray (5ml/L water)

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Nov-Jan): 90-110 days after transplanting, yield 20-25 tons/ha

The Crop Guide Application helps you explore complete crop information for grains, fruits, and vegetables. Select your location and crop, and get detailed guidance from planting to cultivation. Plus, discover relevant government schemes and support programs to boost your farming journey! Perfect for farmers, students, and agriculture enthusiasts.
This scheme provides insurance coverage and financial support to farmers in the event of crop failure due to natural calamities, pests, or diseases.
- All farmers growing notified crops in a notified area.\n- Must have an insurable interest (land ownership or tenancy).\n- Loanee and non-loanee farmers are eligible.

- Covers all food and oilseed crops and annual commercial/horticultural crops.
- Premium Rates:
 • 2% for Kharif crops
 • 1.5% for Rabi crops
 • 5% for commercial/horticultural crops
- Balance premium paid by government subsidy.
- Claims calculated using remote sensing and weather data.
- Kharif Season: Typically April to July\n- Rabi Season: October to December
Apply through the nearest bank, Common Service Centre (CSC), or online at https://pmfby.gov.in/
Provides ₹6,000 per year in 3 equal installments to eligible farmer families, directly into their bank accounts.

Small and marginal farmers with up to 2 hectares of land.

The scheme was later extended to all land-holding farmers, except:

- Institutional landholders
- Income tax payers
- Retired professionals holding constitutional posts
\u20B92,000 every four months (April–July, Aug–Nov, Dec–March).\n\nMust have Aadhaar-linked bank account and land records.
Online via https://pmkisan.gov.in\n\nOr visit local CSC centers or agriculture department office.
A voluntary and contributory pension scheme for small and marginal farmers offering ₹3,000 monthly pension after the age of 60.
- Age: 18–40 years\n- Landholding: Up to 2 hectares\n- Must not be covered under EPFO, NPS, or any government pension scheme.

- Monthly contribution: ₹55–₹200 based on age.
- Government contributes an equal amount.
- Pension begins at age 60.
- Option to exit with contributions if farmer dies or opts out.
Apply through CSC centers. Aadhaar, land documents, and savings bank account are required.
This scheme provides medium to long-term debt financing for investment in viable agricultural infrastructure like cold storage, warehouses, and supply chain facilities.
- Farmers, FPOs, PACS, agri-entrepreneurs, startups, and cooperatives.\n- State agencies and local bodies also eligible.
- Loans up to ₹2 crore per project at subsidized interest.\n- Interest subvention: 3% per annum up to ₹2 crore for 7 years.\n- Credit guarantee available for eligible borrowers.
- Scheme valid from 2020 to 2032.\n- Apply any time within this duration.
Apply online via https://agriinfra.dac.gov.in\nOr visit your local bank for guided application process.
